conclusion: Analyzing the motion of objects A and B using the v-t graph to compare displacements over time.
The graph shows velocity (v) vs. time (t) for two objects A and B, both curves start at the origin (0,0) and end at time t₁ on the t-axis.
Object A has a higher velocity curve than object B throughout the interval.
Both objects are moving in the same direction along a straight line.
Displacement is the area under the v-t curve.
Displacement of A = area under curve A from 0 to t; Displacement of B = area under curve B from 0 to t.
Define D_A(t) = displacement of object A at time t, D_B(t) = displacement of object B at time t, ΔD(t) = D_A(t) - D_B(t) = difference in displacement at time t.
For the difference in displacement to be continuously increasing, d(ΔD)/dt > 0 for all t in [0, t₁].
The rate of change of displacement is velocity.
d(D_A)/dt = v_A(t), d(D_B)/dt = v_B(t), d(ΔD)/dt = v_A(t) - v_B(t).
Since v_A(t) > v_B(t) for all t in [0, t₁], d(ΔD)/dt > 0 for all t in [0, t₁], meaning ΔD(t) is continuously increasing.
The difference in displacement between the two objects is necessarily continuously increasing during the time interval from 0 to t₁.
